title: East Fjords

image.alt: Dramatic East Fjords landscape with mountains and ocean

quote.text: The mountains are calling and I must go.
quote.author: John Muir

shortSummary: Wind through Iceland's East Fjords with their dramatic coastal roads, picturesque fishing villages, and hidden waterfalls, experiencing a more authentic side of Iceland away from the crowds.
summary: Journey through Iceland's spectacular East Fjords, a region of winding coastal roads, dramatic mountain vistas, and colorful fishing villages. Today's adventure takes you from the lobster capital of H√∂fn to the remote Borgarfj√∂r√∞ur Eystri, with stunning photo stops at iconic locations like Vestrahorn mountain and Hvalnes Lighthouse. Enjoy a more relaxed pace with scenic viewpoints and Petra's unique stone collection. The East Fjords offer a more authentic glimpse of Iceland away from the crowds, with landscapes that rival the country's more famous attractions.

schedule.title: Drive to Vestrahorn
schedule.description: Depart early for Vestrahorn mountain and Stokksnes beach to take advantage of morning light for photography.

schedule.title: Vestrahorn and Stokksnes Beach
schedule.description: Experience one of Iceland's most photogenic mountains with its jagged peaks rising dramatically above a black sand beach. The reflections in the wet sand during low tide create stunning photo opportunities.
details: 756m high mountain with striking jagged peaks
Black sand beach with perfect mountain reflections
Viking village film set nearby (when open)
Entry fee paid at Viking Caf√© near the entrance

schedule.title: Drive to Hvalnes Lighthouse
schedule.description: Head to this iconic orange lighthouse along the coast.

schedule.title: Hvalnes Lighthouse
schedule.description: Visit this striking orange lighthouse perched on dramatic black beaches with views of Eystrahorn mountain. The lighthouse offers excellent photo opportunities and a glimpse into Iceland's maritime history.
details: Distinctive bright orange lighthouse built in 1954
Dramatic contrast against black sand beaches and mountains
Great views of Eystrahorn mountain in the distance
Located on a narrow peninsula with rough seas on both sides
One of the most photogenic lighthouses in Iceland

schedule.title: East Fjords Coastal Drive
schedule.description: Continue the spectacular drive along the East Fjords, one of Iceland's most scenic coastal routes. The winding road takes you through deep fjords, past towering mountains, and through small fishing villages.
details: Dramatic scenery with mountains plunging into the sea
Multiple viewpoints perfect for photo stops
Keep an eye out for wildlife including reindeer and seabirds
Much less crowded than other parts of Iceland
Road occasionally narrows to one lane but traffic is light

schedule.title: Drive to Petra's Stone Collection
schedule.description: Continue your journey along the coast toward Petra's Stone Collection, with a stop at a picturesque waterfall along the way.
quickStops: Folaldafoss Waterfall - easily accessible cascade visible from the road with a short walking path (15 minutes)

schedule.title: Petra's Stone Collection

Beautiful garden setting with stones arranged throughout
Many rare specimens specific to Iceland's unique geology

schedule.title: Dinner at Alfheimar Hotel Restaurant
schedule.description: Enjoy dinner at the hotel restaurant, which serves traditional Icelandic cuisine using locally-sourced ingredients.

highlights: Photographing the dramatic peaks of Vestrahorn mountain
The scenic coastal drive through the East Fjords with numerous quick stops
The striking orange Hvalnes Lighthouse against black beaches
Exploring unique minerals at Petra's Stone Collection

accommodation.notes: Note that a small cruise ship (Azamara Quest, 698 passengers) will be docking in the region today, but most East Fjords attractions are spread out enough that crowds shouldn't be an issue if you start early.

alternatives.title: Tv√≠s√∂ngur Sound Sculpture
alternatives.description: A concrete sound sculpture designed by German artist Lukas K√ºhne, consisting of five interconnected domes of different sizes. Each dome has its own resonance that corresponds to the Icelandic tradition of five-tone harmony.

alternatives.title: F√°skr√∫√∞sfj√∂r√∞ur French Connection
alternatives.description: Village with strong historical ties to French fishermen, featuring a French museum, bilingual street signs, and the annual French Days festival (if visiting in July). The renovated French Hospital now serves as a hotel and museum.

alternatives.title: B√∫landstindur Mountain
alternatives.description: Distinctive pyramid-shaped mountain rising 1,069m above Dj√∫pivogur. According to local legend, the mountain fulfills wishes during the summer solstice. A hiking trail leads to the summit for panoramic views.

alternatives.title: Papey Island Boat Tour
alternatives.description: Boat tour to abandoned island with abundant birdlife including puffins. The island was inhabited until 1966 and contains Iceland's oldest and smallest wooden church.

alternatives.title: Rau√∞ubj√∂rg (Red Rocks)
alternatives.description: Distinctive red rhyolite cliffs contrasting dramatically with black sand beaches. The striking colors are the result of volcanic activity and make for excellent photography opportunities.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Skaftfell Center for Visual Art
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Contemporary art gallery showcasing works by local and international artists, with a focus on East Iceland's artistic heritage.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Wilderness Center
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Museum and exhibition about life in the Icelandic highlands, featuring interactive displays, historical artifacts, and stories of survival in harsh conditions.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: East Iceland Heritage Museum
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Collection of historical artifacts showcasing the cultural history and daily life in East Iceland through the centuries.

tip: The East Fjords have Iceland's largest population of wild reindeer. They were introduced in the 18th century and are most commonly spotted in this region, especially in the morning and evening hours.
notes: This is a long driving day with multiple stops, so keeping to schedule is important. The roads through the East Fjords are paved but winding, with occasional single-lane bridges and tunnels. Note that the Azamara Quest cruise ship will be in port today with 698 passengers, so some locations might be busier than usual during midday hours.
